Category page pattern

Category page pattern

A category page pattern for navigation to business topic pages.

On this page
  • Page anatomy
  • Guidelines for use
  • Examples

Page anatomy

1

Heading (topic title)

2

Header description

3

Tile heading

4

Tile description

Rules

Open all
button toggle all accordions
1Heading (topic title)

A direct, short title focused on the main topic the user will learn about.

  • Maximum character limit of 50.
  • Page title is the business topic.
2Header description

A short paragraph that expands on what the topic is about on the page is and why it is important.

  • The supporting text should always start with one of the following:
    • “Find out …”
    • “Learn how …”
    • “Understand …”
  • Include the top three keywords for the page.
  • Maximum character limit of 90.
3Tile heading

A direct, short title focused on the main topic the user will learn about.

  • Maximum character limit of 50.
  • Page title is the business topic.
4Tile description

This is automatically populated using the level 2 short description:

  • Use one of these three intro phrases: “learn how to”, “understand” or “find out”. 
  • Include the top three keywords for the page. 
  • Maximum character limit of 90.

Guidelines for use

Purpose

A category page is the level 1 page. It provides the user with enough information to navigate to the level 2 pages under each business topic. The content is pulled from metadata from pages below to populate the content tiles.

It should always include:

  • The name of the business topic it is related to.
  • Level 2 pages that relate to the topic (this may include content that sits under the topic in the information architecture or from other topics).

Examples

View the planning category page on business.gov.au
